title: I want to be a housewife, what do I do? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you wish to be a housewife then please do consider where you and desired children would be if: Husband leaves you for another woman / manHusband becomes bored w/ you and loses interestHusband becomes disabled and insurance doesn't adequately cover lost income nor medical/dental care for him + you and kids, nor costs for remodeling to make house user friendly for the disabilityHusband dies prematurely and you must perform all housewifely, motherly, financial management duties PLUS make up income deficit or lower your family's standard of livingA child gets serious illness or dies causing marriage to fail (very high risk event)[consider any event doesn't happen when you are still young / youngish but later on]On the other hand, what if you get bored with housewifely duties? Lots of things can surprise us in the Life Lotto. It might be a good idea to have a solid backup plan in case your spouse is not able to be there financially for your lifetime. Just a few thoughts! Best

Meet and marry someone who wants a stay-at-home wife. Own your life and don’t let the criticism of others stop you. Women are criticized for working and for not working, for marrying and for not being married, for having kids and for not having kids, for baking from scratch and from buying from the store. You do you. Smile and don’t apologize for the choices that you believe in. Branding helps. You’re not a “housewife” you’re a home-maker. One piece of advice though, career skills give families options. Keep yours up to date through reading, writing and volunteering. Irrespective of the strength of your relationship, you never know when life is going to intervene and change your path. Own also that there are risks to these sort of choices. Own that there is a risk that your ambitions may change or that your spouse’s expectations or your family’s circumstances may become altered. Do your best to keep your eyes open, your expectations realistic and give yourself insurance against the slings and arrows of outrageous fortune.
